title: Move the plates change in E and V

content.description: The conducting plate shown has plate area <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and plate thickness <math alttext="d" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. The plate is given a charge <math alttext="positive Q" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mo>+</mo><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and then isolated.
content.question: A second identical plate with a charge <math alttext="negative Q" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>âˆ’</mo><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is added a short distance above the first plate, as shown in the figure. If <math alttext="E" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is the magnitude of the electric field a short distance off the original plate, which of the following statements is correct for the magnitude of the electric field between the plates?

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
